tools.name: GitHub Student Developer Pack
tools.short_desc: Access a massive bundle of developer tools, cloud credits, IDEs, and more for free.
tools.benefit: Unlocks an entire ecosystem of premium dev tools and services with a single student verification.
tools.verification: Requires GitHub Education student verification (typically a school email or proof of enrollment).

tools.name: Google Antigravity
tools.short_desc: Google's AI-first IDE for modern development workflows.
tools.benefit: Lets you experiment with AI-assisted coding and modern cloud-native workflows without extra cost.
tools.verification: Generally available with a Google account; check the page for any region or access limitations.

tools.name: Visual Studio Community Edition
tools.short_desc: Free full-featured IDE for .NET, C++, and cross-platform development.
tools.benefit: Gives you the same IDE used in industry for building professional Windows and .NET applications.
tools.verification: Free for individual developers, students, and certain organizations; no special student proof typically required.

tools.name: JetBrains Student License
tools.short_desc: Free access to all JetBrains IDEs (PyCharm, IntelliJ, WebStorm, CLion, etc.).
tools.benefit: Unlocks pro-level IDEs for almost every major language and platform while you're a student.
tools.verification: Requires a verified student status (usually student email or ISIC/other proof).

tools.name: Replit for Students
tools.short_desc: Browser-based development + hosting with student-friendly upgrades.
tools.benefit: Lets you code, collaborate, and deploy from the browser without needing a local setup.
tools.verification: Some education-specific benefits may require school domain or classroom setup; base tier is free.

tools.name: GitKraken Student Pack
tools.short_desc: Premium Git client and workflow tooling for students.
tools.benefit: Helps you visualize Git history and manage repos more easily during coursework and projects.
tools.verification: Usually tied to GitHub Student Developer Pack or student email verification.

tools.name: Azure for Students
tools.short_desc: $100 credit, free App Services, VMs ‚Äî no credit card required.
tools.benefit: Gives you real cloud resources to deploy apps, databases, and services for coursework and side projects.
tools.verification: Requires proof of student status (typically via academic email).

tools.name: AWS Educate
tools.short_desc: Credits + sandbox environments for learning AWS cloud.
tools.benefit: Provides AWS credits and training environments to practice cloud skills.
tools.verification: Requires student registration with school details; eligibility varies by region and institution.

tools.name: Google Cloud Free Tier
tools.short_desc: Always-free compute, serverless hosting, and ML APIs.
tools.benefit: Lets you run small services, APIs, and ML workloads continuously at no cost.
tools.verification: Requires a Google account; some free-tier usage may still ask for a card for identity verification.

tools.name: Oracle Cloud Free Tier
tools.short_desc: Always-free ARM VMs, databases, object storage, etc.
tools.benefit: Provides persistent VMs and managed databases suitable for learning Linux, databases, and cloud.
tools.verification: Requires creating an Oracle Cloud account; identity verification may vary by region.

tools.name: DigitalOcean Credits (via GitHub Pack)
tools.short_desc: Deploy apps, containers, and databases easily.
tools.benefit: Use cloud credits to spin up real servers and services for your apps.
tools.verification: Tied to GitHub Student Developer Pack eligibility.

tools.name: Google Gemini Pro AI
tools.short_desc: Advanced AI model for free ‚Äî text, code, embedding & more.
tools.benefit: Lets you integrate state-of-the-art AI into projects and experiments without extra cost.
tools.verification: Requires a Google account and acceptance of API or product terms.

tools.name: Kaggle
tools.short_desc: Free GPU & TPU notebooks for ML experiments.
tools.benefit: Provides hosted Jupyter-like notebooks with free accelerators for training and experimenting.
tools.verification: Requires a Kaggle account; no formal student verification for free usage.

tools.name: Google Colab
tools.short_desc: Free cloud notebook environment with GPU access.
tools.benefit: Lets you run Python notebooks with GPUs directly in the browser.
tools.verification: Requires a Google account; free tier is open to all.

tools.name: AWS SageMaker Studio Lab
tools.short_desc: Free T4 GPU for training ML models.
tools.benefit: Offers a managed environment with free GPU time for ML workloads.
tools.verification: Requires sign-up and approval; usage is time-limited and subject to AWS policies.

tools.name: Hugging Face
tools.short_desc: Models, datasets, Spaces, and inference endpoints.
tools.benefit: Central place to find, host, and experiment with pre-trained models and datasets.
tools.verification: Requires a Hugging Face account; most community resources are free to browse and use within limits.

tools.name: Weights & Biases
tools.short_desc: Experiment tracking and model performance visualization.
tools.benefit: Helps you log metrics, compare runs, and manage experiments professionally.
tools.verification: Free tier available; educational or research upgrades may require additional details.

tools.name: MongoDB Atlas (Student Credit)
tools.short_desc: Fully-managed cloud NoSQL database with student credit.
tools.benefit: Lets you run real MongoDB clusters in the cloud without managing servers.
tools.verification: Student-specific offers may require GitHub Education or school email; base free tier is general.

tools.name: Firebase
tools.short_desc: Authentication, hosting, realtime DB, and serverless functions.
tools.benefit: Gives you a full backend stack (auth, DB, hosting) for web and mobile apps.
tools.verification: Requires a Google account; generous free tier available without student-specific proof.

tools.name: AWS DynamoDB
tools.short_desc: NoSQL database with an always-free usage tier.
tools.benefit: Lets you use a production-grade NoSQL store within free-tier limits.
tools.verification: Requires an AWS account; free-tier usage is time and volume limited.

tools.name: AWS S3
tools.short_desc: Object storage with Free Tier for hosting/static apps.
tools.benefit: Great for storing static sites, assets, and data archives.
tools.verification: Requires an AWS account; free tier has usage limits.

tools.name: Azure Cosmos DB Free Tier
tools.short_desc: Global distributed database with a generous free tier.
tools.benefit: Lets you experiment with globally replicated NoSQL databases.
tools.verification: Requires an Azure account; free tier is capacity-limited.

tools.name: Oracle Autonomous Database
tools.short_desc: Always-free self-driving database.
tools.benefit: Provides managed database instances that handle tuning and maintenance.
tools.verification: Requires an Oracle Cloud account; free tier has resource limits.

tools.name: Sentry
tools.short_desc: Error monitoring and performance tracking for applications.
tools.benefit: Helps you catch and debug errors in real time in your apps.
tools.verification: Free tier available; education programs may require additional details.

tools.name: Heroku (GitHub Pack Version)
tools.short_desc: Simple app deployment for students.
tools.benefit: Push code and get a live app without managing infrastructure.
tools.verification: Student benefits are tied to GitHub Student Developer Pack eligibility.

tools.name: GitHub Actions
tools.short_desc: CI/CD automation built directly into GitHub.
tools.benefit: Lets you run tests, builds, and deployments automatically on every push or PR.
tools.verification: Included with GitHub accounts; usage is limited by free-tier runner minutes.

tools.name: Microsoft Certifications for Students
tools.short_desc: Free/discounted opportunities to earn industry credentials.
tools.benefit: Lets you validate skills with recognized certifications.
tools.verification: Typically requires linking to a student account or school email.

tools.name: JetBrains Academy / Hyperskill
tools.short_desc: Project-based interactive learning with student pricing.
tools.benefit: Helps you learn by building guided, real-world style projects.
tools.verification: Student discounts may require academic email or proof; some content is free.

tools.name: IBM SkillsBuild
tools.short_desc: Free cybersecurity, cloud, and data science courses.
tools.benefit: Provides structured learning paths with badges and practical labs.
tools.verification: Requires registration; some programs may partner with institutions.

tools.name: DataCamp
tools.short_desc: Student-discount access to Python, data science, and ML courses.
tools.benefit: Gives you access to interactive courses in data and analytics.
tools.verification: Student discounts typically require an academic email or proof.

tools.name: Coursera for Campus
tools.short_desc: Free access if your institution participates.
tools.benefit: Allows you to take university and industry courses via your school.
tools.verification: Requires your institution to be enrolled; access is via school login.

tools.name: Canva Pro for Students
tools.short_desc: Presentation & design tool with premium student access.
tools.benefit: Lets you design slides, posters, and social graphics with pro templates.
tools.verification: Requires school domain or verification through an education program.

tools.name: Figma Professional
tools.short_desc: Free Pro plan for students and educators.
tools.benefit: Gives you full Figma features for UI/UX design and collaboration.
tools.verification: Requires application with academic email or proof.

tools.name: Adobe Creative Cloud
tools.short_desc: Full suite at a discounted student rate.
tools.benefit: Access to Photoshop, Illustrator, Premiere, and more at reduced pricing.
tools.verification: Requires proof of enrollment (usually via student email or documentation).

tools.name: Autodesk Tools
tools.short_desc: Free AutoCAD, Maya, and more.
tools.benefit: Gives you access to industry CAD and 3D tools used in engineering and media.
tools.verification: Requires Autodesk Education account and proof of academic status.

tools.name: Unity Student Plan
tools.short_desc: Game development engine with student benefits.
tools.benefit: Provides access to Unity tools and learning resources tailored to students.
tools.verification: Requires student status verification through Unity's education portal.

tools.name: TryHackMe
tools.short_desc: Hands-on cybersecurity labs with student paths.
tools.benefit: Lets you practice offensive and defensive security in guided environments.
tools.verification: Base tier is free; student discounts or team access may require verification.

tools.name: Hack The Box Academy
tools.short_desc: Free foundational cybersecurity content + discounts.
tools.benefit: Provides structured learning paths with real-world style labs.
tools.verification: Requires an HTB account; some student offerings may need proof.

tools.name: Splunk for Students
tools.short_desc: Free access to Splunk fundamentals.
tools.benefit: Teaches you how to use SIEM/log analytics platforms used in SOCs.
tools.verification: Typically part of Splunk education/Work+ programs; may need school details.

tools.name: Palo Alto CyberAces
tools.short_desc: Free cybersecurity learning program.
tools.benefit: Offers foundational cybersecurity theory and practice content.
tools.verification: Free to register; no strict student-only requirement in most cases.

tools.name: Microsoft 365 (with School Account)
tools.short_desc: Word, Excel, PowerPoint, Teams ‚Äî free for most universities.
tools.benefit: Gives you core productivity tools needed for coursework and collaboration.
tools.verification: Requires eligible school email; availability depends on institution.

tools.name: Notion (Education Plan)
tools.short_desc: Notes, projects, documentation ‚Äî free for students.
tools.benefit: Centralizes planning, notes, and docs into a single workspace.
tools.verification: Education plan generally requires academic email sign-up.

tools.name: Overleaf
tools.short_desc: Collaborative LaTeX editor for papers & reports.
tools.benefit: Makes writing LaTeX documents easier with real-time collaboration.
tools.verification: Free tier is open to all; institutional features may require campus agreements.

tools.name: Zotero
tools.short_desc: Powerful citation & reference manager.
tools.benefit: Helps you organize sources and generate citations/bibliographies.
tools.verification: Free to use; no specific student verification required.
